abstract: Politico has learned that current and former C.I.A. agents are using their lie-detecting and interrogation techniques to help Wall Street make money.
snippet: Politico has learned that current and former C.I.A. agents are using their lie-detecting and interrogation techniques to help Wall Street make money.
lead_paragraph: Update | 1:38 p.m. Corporate executives might want to think twice before they speak on the next company conference call with analysts. That’s because agents of the Central Intelligence Agency could be on the line scrutinizing their every word to see if they are telling the whole truth. No, the agents aren’t working on behalf of the government; they are moonlighting for financial firms eager to gain an edge anyway they can.

headline.main: Who’s on the Line? It Could Be the C.I.A.
